snippet: The rules, known as Basel III, are intended to ensure that banks can survive financial shocks like the crisis in 2008, mostly by requiring them to raise more capital.
abstract: The rules, known as Basel III, are intended to ensure that banks can survive financial shocks like the crisis in 2008, mostly by requiring them to raise more capital.

headline.main: Fed Wants U.S. Banks to Adhere to Stiffer International Rules
headline.print_headline: Fed Wants Stiffer Global Rules for Banks
